strings.Phase_Title: Phase 1.1: Bethlehem - Basilica of the Nativity
strings.POI001_Content: The Basilica of the Nativity was built in 333 AD by Emperor Constantine and his mother Helena. It is one of the oldest churches in the world still in use.
strings.POI002_Content: This silver star marks the exact spot where Jesus was born, according to tradition. The inscription reads: 'Here Jesus Christ was born of the Virgin Mary'.
strings.POI003_Content: The site of Jesus' birth is marked by an ornamentation representing the stable and manger where the Baby Jesus was placed.
strings.NPC001_Greeting: Peace be with you, pilgrim! Welcome to the Basilica of the Nativity.
strings.NPC001_Option1: Tell me about the history of this basilica.
strings.NPC001_Option2: What does the Silver Star mean?
strings.NPC001_Response1: This basilica was built in 333 AD over the traditional birthplace of Jesus. It has been a pilgrimage site for nearly 1700 years!
strings.NPC001_Response2: The star marks the precise location of Jesus' birth. According to tradition, the cave where he was born is directly beneath this sacred point.
strings.NPC001_Response3: Jesus was born in a cave that served as a stable. These caves were common in Bethlehem at that time, used to shelter animals.
strings.POI005_Prompt: Take a photo to remember your visit to the Basilica of the Nativity!
strings.POI006_Verse: And she brought forth her firstborn son, and wrapped him in swaddling clothes, and laid him in a manger; because there was no room for them in the inn.
strings.Puzzle_Instructions: Arrange the events in the correct chronological order.
strings.Puzzle_Event3: Mary and Joseph travel to Bethlehem
strings.Puzzle_Event7: Simeon blesses Jesus in the temple
strings.Puzzle_Hint1: Starts with Mary's visit to Elizabeth.
strings.Puzzle_Hint2: The census came before the journey to Bethlehem.
strings.Puzzle_Success: Congratulations! You correctly ordered the Nativity events!
